metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12976 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
git-annex before 6.20170818 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via an ssh URL with an initial dash character in the hostname, as demonstrated by an ssh://-eProxyCommand= URL, a related issue to CVE-2017-9800, CVE-2017-12836, CVE-2017-1000116, and CVE-2017-1000117.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git-annex - 6.20170818-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> security-fake-sync fails with "Original tarballs differ. Aborting"

criterions.comment: git-annex package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.20170818-1').
